Reason: The configuration option cas_contention_timeout_in_ms in the Cassandra project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the timeout for contention resolution in the system. A lower timeout value can lead to quicker resolution of contention but may also increase the likelihood of conflicts and retries, potentially impacting system performance. On the other hand, a higher timeout value may reduce conflicts but could also increase latency and resource consumption. Therefore, changes to this configuration can significantly affect system performance by influencing the trade-off between contention resolution speed and system stability.
